description.raw:
I would like to back to use "RelWithDebInfo" to build gazebo packages. While this is can be done from releasing tools with current gazebo code, I prefer to keep in sync the default build mode with packages build mode.

Changes implies:

* O3 -> O2 which did not show a big improvement in the past. I run a [jenkins performance comparisson](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/performance-comparisson-release-modes/performance/?) where runs 3,4,5 are with O3 and runs 6,7,8 are with O2 and results does not show a big drop to stop this change.
* Use RelWithDebInfo will bring back the debugging symbols (-g) 
* Assertions will be enabled again, since there is no -DNDEBUG.
description.html:
I would like to back to use "RelWithDebInfo" to build gazebo packages. While this is can be done from releasing tools with current gazebo code, I prefer to keep in sync the default build mode with packages build mode.

Changes implies:

  • O3 -> O2 which did not show a big improvement in the past. I run a jenkins performance comparisson where runs 3,4,5 are with O3 and runs 6,7,8 are with O2 and results does not show a big drop to stop this change.
  • Use RelWithDebInfo will bring back the debugging symbols (-g)
  • Assertions will be enabled again, since there is no -DNDEBUG.

title.raw: Use RelWithDebInfo mode for compiling as default
